title: Perceptions of Physicians on the Combination of Pantoprazole + Domperidone vs Pantoprazole Monotherapy in GERD Management

questions.question: Approximately, what percentage of patients with symptoms of GERD do you encounter and manage every month?
Which of the following clinical criteria do you most commonly prefer to diagnose GERD?
options: I use all of the above, depending on the case

questions.question: Which class of medication do you most frequently initiate as first-line therapy for GERD?
Kindly rate the frequency of the following symptoms you encounter in your patients with GERD.
In your clinical practice, which drug class do you find most likely to cause GERD symptoms in patients?
What percentage of your GERD patients, in your clinical experience, achieve adequate symptom resolution with PPI monotherapy?
options: Less than 25% (PPI monotherapy is not sufficient)

questions.question: What is the primary reason you prefer to add a prokinetic such as domperidone to a PPI-based GERD therapy?
options: To address dyspeptic symptoms like bloating and early satiety
To enhance the efficacy of the PPI by improving gastric emptying
To manage nocturnal GERD symptoms or improve LES functioning
To reduce the need for higher PPI doses

questions.question: How frequently do you prefer to prescribe a combination of pantoprazole + domperidone for GERD patients in your clinical practice?
options: Very Frequently (in more than 75% of GERD cases)

questions.question: In which patient profile do you consider the pantoprazole + domperidone combination to be most clinically beneficial?
options: Patients with classic GERD symptoms (heartburn, regurgitation)
GERD patients who specifically have LES dysfunction or gastroparesis
Patients who did not respond adequately to PPI monotherapy
Patients requiring sustained, long-term control of GERD symptoms

questions.question: What is your usual duration for prescribing Pantoprazole + Domperidone in GERD patients?
options: Tailored duration based on individual patient needs

questions.question: Relative to PPI monotherapy, how would you rate the efficacy of the pantoprazole + domperidone combination in achieving symptom relief for GERD?
In your view, to what extent does the pantoprazole + domperidone combination improve patient quality of life compared to PPI monotherapy?
options: Significantly improves quality of life compared with monotherapy
Moderately improves quality of life compared with monotherapy
Offers no significant improvement in quality of life compared with monotherapy

questions.question: How does patient adherence to the pantoprazole + domperidone combination compare with a PPI monotherapy regimen?
options: Adherence is lower with the combination
Adherence is comparable between the combination and monotherapy
Adherence is higher with the combination
No significant difference in adherence between the two
